edu.ncsu.csc.itrust.risk

? RiskChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.itrust.risk.RiskChecker
  • ??????:
    HeartDiseaseRisks, Type1DiabetesRisks, Type2DiabetesRisks

    public abstract class RiskChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class which has a number of utlity methods for checking risks. When extending this class, use the methods to fill in all of the necessary information. Then use isAtRisk and getPatientRiskFactors to get the actual risks. See the known subclasses for an example
    ??:
    Andy

      • isAtRisk

        public boolean isAtRisk()
        This method exists purely for performance - just stop once you hit the threshold.

        Also, the risk factors should be cached in the RiskFactor implementors - in getPatientRiskFactors there should be no double-querying
        ??:
        isAtRisk

        public java.util.List<PatientRiskFactor> getPatientRiskFactors()
